LanguageData.RimpsycheUsePreferenceSystemTooltip: Give each pawns their own preference.
LanguageData.RimpsycheRomanceAttemptGenderDiffTooltip: Women are less likely to make a romance attempt at men. (Vanilla logic)
LanguageData.RimpsycheMinRelAttractionTooltip: Minimum attraction towards pawns one is interested in will be adjusted to this.
LanguageData.RPS_KinseyTooltip:
The Kinsey scale uses a range from 0 to 6 to describe a person's sexual orientation.

0 - exclusively heterosexual
3 - bisexual
6 - exclusively homosexual
LanguageData.RPC_HeterosexualDescription: {0} is romantically attracted to people of the opposite gender.
LanguageData.RPC_BisexualDescription: {0} is romantically attracted to both men and women.
LanguageData.RPC_HomosexualDescription: {0} is romantically attracted to people of the same gender.
LanguageData.RPC_AsexualDescription: {0} has no sexual attraction to anyone at all.
LanguageData.RPC_SexualityUndefinedDescription: {0} has lost their sexuality. Can you find it for them?
LanguageData.RPS_KinseySliderTooltip: Move the slider left or right to adjust how strongly the pawn is attracted to each gender.\nThe middle represents equal attraction to both genders, while either end represents attraction only to males or only to females.
LanguageData.RPS_AttractionTooltip:
Max Attraction represents the level of sexual attraction the pawn feels toward their preferred gender.
Attraction toward the less preferred gender is scaled proportionally according to the Kinsey rating.

If Max Attraction is sufficiently low, the pawn will be considered asexual
